meanings.definition: Make (someone) unable to think, feel, or react normally because of cold or shock.
meanings.sent1: The freezing wind numbing my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The dentist used a numbing gel before the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was so cold, it was numbing my taste buds!
meanings.sent4: The shocking news was like a numbing blow to her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the graveyard was numbing to the senses.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel a loss of sensation.
meanings.sent1: The tight bandage was numbing his arm.
meanings.sent2: The cold water numbing his feet as he waded through the stream.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick left the audience in a numbing state of confusion.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous lecture was numbing the students' interest.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet was numbing to her ears.
